Title: Gamburg CPA PC

About: Our expertise in this niche international taxation market allows us to help companies and individuals with their foreign filing requirements, tax filings in the United States, and global tax planning. We work closely with your tax advisor in your home country to understand your global tax exposure and plan to minimize your global tax liability to the extent allowed by the tax code. Sometimes something as simple as a lack of coordination between the two tax professionals in each respective country can expose the client to a tax liability at the highest marginal rate in both countries. We work with the foreign tax professional to understand each other’s needs and create the most efficient tax planning strategy for our clients. We provide services anywhere from a simple scenario, where we make sure that income that is taxed by one country is properly credited for the taxes paid on such income by the other country, to a complex scenario, where we deal with income sourcing based on tax treaties between the countries and subpart F income. We provide qualitative research services for extremely specific and low incidence target demographic populations, anywhere in the world.

Task, interviews and surveys can involve videos, display ads, social media assets, usability of software user interfaces, landing pages and websites, prototypes, concepts and messaging.

This innovative service transforms qualitative research to a home or workplace based simulated lab environment, by compositing a 360 degree view of the participant reaction and interaction with any type of asset, task, questionnaire or concept, whether offline or online in nature.

Because of the low barriers to participation, and by combining with customized social and digital media based recruitment, highly specific and low incidence populations can be targeted and tested, within their home or workplace environment, in a fraction of the time and at a fraction of the cost of traditional qualitative research.

This eliminates the problems of demographic mismatch, geography, contextual bias, time and cost associated with traditional qualitative testing.

Title: Trade Consulting Services
SubTitle: Export and Import Consulting, United States
Main Area of Expertise: Customs Brokerage in the United States
About: Trade Consulting Services (TCS) is a firm specializing in helping manufacturers and exporters understand their responsibilities under the import and export regulations of the United States.

The United States Government (USG) controls the export of goods, services and technology as a way of maintaining our national security and promoting foreign policy objectives. As a result, all goods, services and technology require prior written approval from the USG before they can be provided to a foreign company, person or government.

There are several regulations that govern the export of products, primarily the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) and the Export Administration Regulations (EAR). Each of these regulations control different products and have their own requirements.

MyEsiNum is making use of the +883 global country code newly created by the ITU (International Telecommunication Union).One number, worldwide, for life!

Title: Michael J. Horton Law Office
SubTitle: Customs And Import Law, United States
Main Area of Expertise: Customs Law in the United States
About: Practicing Customs and Import law since 1979.

Admitted to Bar in California, 1979; U.S. District Court, Northern District of California, 1979; U.S. Court of International Trade, 1980.  Author: Import and Customs Law Handbook, Quorum Books, Greenwood Publishing Group, Westport, CT, 1992.

Mr. Horton graduated with distinction from Indiana University at Bloomington, Indiana, with a Bachelor of Arts degree in English in 1964.  Subsequent to his graduation, he was elected to the honorary collegiate society, Phi Beta Kappa.

Mr. Horton joined the United States Customs Service as an Import Specialist in August, 1964, which position he held until August, 1966, when he was furloughed to the United States Army.  He served in Vietnam from March 1967 until March 1968.

After his return to the Customs Service in 1968, Mr. Horton was promoted to the position of Import Specialist (Team Leader) and was assigned responsibility for control and duty determinations on synthetic and ornamented wearing apparel.
Mr. Horton completed academic requirements for his Doctor of Jurisprudence at Golden Gate University School of Law in December of 1978 and graduated with Honors in June of 1979.
Since his admission to the State Bar of California in May of 1979, Mr. Horton has engaged full-time in the private practice of Customs Law and related International Trade Law matters.

Through 24 campus-based regional centers, and 29 outreach offices, the NYS SBDC applies the resources of university, private sector, and government to solve business problems and foster entrepreneurship.
The SBDC emphasizes counseling and training services to women, veterans, people with special needs, and minority clients.

About: Compliance Services International (CSI) provides innovative solutions for organizations faced with regulatory and environmental challenges. CSI approaches all projects with a strong commitment to responsible science, to the environment and to risk management. Our mission is to serve our clients with scientifically-sound, cost-effective, and timely approaches to environmental assessment and regulatory compliance. With operations in the USA and Europe, global regulatory strategies are developed for companies wishing to market their products internationally.CSI?s staff has extensive research and regulatory experience in various chemical industries. CSI specialists are skilled problem solvers in international regulatory affairs, regulatory due diligence, toxicology & ecotoxicology, risk assessment, contract research management, litigation support, information systems and task force management. Our European operation stems from a USA base that has grown into a multi-disciplined consulting and contract research organization. CSI-Europe was launched in mid-2000 to provide regulatory and environmental strategies for key sectors of the global chemistry industry - agrochemicals, antimicrobials (biocides), specialty and industrial chemicals and animal health pharmaceuticals. Joint USA-European strategies are developed for US companies wishing to market their products in Europe and vice versa - and specific project work is performed for multinational companies exploring European and other markets.CSI-Europe headquarters are located in the Pentlands Science Park, Edinburgh, Scotland where its resources and strong technology presence complement our US activities.

About: Established in 1987, EPPA is a respected multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural consultancy with a pan-European reach. Reviewing and updating Safety Data Sheets (SDS) taking into account the updates of the current legislation ? Identifying SVHCs in products of its clients through lab tests and preparing certificates on the SVHC content in finished products? Certifying the supply chain of companies and awarding the REACH Compliance Seal for finished products? Designing IT architecture for companies? compliance with REACH? Decreasing registration costs using the ?REACH entity?? Auditing REACH compliance for companies before inspections by EU competent authorities EPPA is registered with the European Transparency Initiative.

Title: The European-American Business Organization, Inc.
SubTitle: Business Consulting,European Union, United States
Main Area of Expertise: Management Consulting in the United States
About: The European-American Business Organization, Inc. (EABO) is a consulting firm specializing in transatlantic business development and international tax services for SMEs and government agencies. It offers a multitude of services such as market entry and expansion strategy, EU compliance (i.e. CE Markings, REACH), early stage venture funding, strategic partner search, international trade show planning, public relations strategies, as well as cross-border tax and legal assistance.One of the major challenges our U.S. customers face regarding their business development in Europe is compliance with EU regulations. REACH (Registration, Evaluation, Authorization and Restriction of Chemical substances) is a European Regulation on chemicals and their safe use. If you export more than one metric ton of chemicals to Europe, then you are required to comply with REACH.Closely related to REACH, the new CLP (Classification, Labeling and Packaging) Regulation incorporates into EU law classification criteria and labeling rules for chemical substances and mixtures. Whether you are a REACH registrant, importer, manufacturer or distributor of chemical substances, you must notify the European Chemical Agency according to the CLP inventory by January 3, 2011 or within one month after you place the substance on the EU market. Regarding REACH and CLP regulations, we assist customers on the following: ? Answer any questions related to REACH and CLP? Updates on the REACH program requirements and modifications to the regulations ? Assist with the registration of your products ? Provide you with our European REACH ?Only Representative? (required for all importers). If you are seeking to address REACH and CLP compliance issues quickly and efficiently, contact EABO today!
